document.docAuthor: Vivallo, Felipe & Melo, Gabriel A. R.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy and geographic distribution of the species of Centris of the hyptidis group (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Centridini), with description of a new species from central Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy and geographic distribution of the species of Centris of the hyptidis group (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Centridini), with description of a new species from central Brazil

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 5–8.
Centris hyptidoides
Roig-Alsina
, 5–6, female (Brazil, Mato Grosso do Sul, Porto Murtinho, DZUP 41119), 7–8, male (Brazil, Mato Grosso do Sul, Porto Murtinho, DZUP 41140). 5, Head, frontal view. 6, Habitus, lateral view. 7, Head, frontal view. 8, Habitus, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. This species is very similar to
C . hyptidis
, being different in the female by the more developed and curved fore elaiospathes, with four giant setae of acute apex beside the primary anterior comb (absent in
C . hyptidis
) and by the yellowish golden pilosity on T 4 –T 6 (in
C . hyptidis
the pilosity of T 4 is black, and white in T 5 and T 6 ). The males of
C . hyptidoides
and
C . hyptidis
are almost structurally indistinguishable, being differentiated by the length of F 1 ( 3.2 times longer than F 2 in
C . hyptidoides
and 2.9 times in
C . hyptidis
), by the band of yellow pilosity of T 1 (continuous in
C . hyptidoides
and interrupted in middle in
C . hyptidis
), and pilosity on T 4 (in
C . hyptidoides
, the apical margin have a complete narrow band of plumose hairs, while in
C. hyptidis
, the band is restricted to lateral portions of tergum). The male of
C. hyptidoides
is described below for the first time.

Description of the male . Measurements : approximate body length: 12.6 ; head width: 4.76 ; forewing legth: 9.4 ; F 1 length: 0.55 ; F 2 length: 0.17 ; F 3 length: 0.3 ; mandible length: 1.8 ; mandible basal width: 0.8 . Coloration : black, with clypeus, labrum, mandibular base, tibial base, paraocular area, supraclipeal area and scape beneath yellow. Wing membrane translucent, slightly infuscated. Pilosity : yellow on head and mesosoma. On ventral area of mesosoma, forelegs, external surface of midtibia, gena, T 1 , T 5 and T 6 withish. T 2 to T 4 , S 2 to S 4 , mid and hindlegs with black hairs, except basis of hind tibiae with yellow setae. On S 4 –S 6 dark brown, with long bristles, forming a semicircular comb. Integument : paraocular area with fine punctures, denser and more marked on vertex, coarser on labrum and clypeus, the latter mostly dull due to fine microsculpture. Metasoma with very dense and fine punctures in T 1 and T 2 , becoming less dense towards the apex of metasoma. Structure : mandible tridentate, 2.2 times longer than wide. Trimmal angle straight, but reduced. Acetabular carina ending at the base of the third tooth. Labrum semicircular. Ocular orbits divergent above. Hind femora with posterior longitudinal carina. Hind tibia swelled. Pygidial plate present, slightly elevated and apically bifurcated.

Distribution .
ARGENTINA :
Formosa : Las Lomitas (
Roig-Alsina, 2000
).
PARAGUAY :
Boquerón: Toledo; San Pedro : Cororo.
BRAZIL : MS:
Porto Murtinho.
